title: Permits jury to consider lesser included offenses when it is unable to agree on a greater offense
summary: Provides that whenever courts submit two or more offenses in the alternative to the jury, and the jury cannot agree on a verdict as to the greatest offense, the court may instruct the jury that it may go on to consider any lesser included offense of that count; provides, however, that the court must instruct the jury that if the defendant is convicted of a lesser included offense, he or she may not be retried on the greater offense.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to jury consideration of lesser included offenses
